attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Meta\", \"resolved_domain\": \"meta.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy\", \"summary\": \"WhatsApp collects account information (phone number, profile name), messages (stored encrypted temporarily for delivery, then deleted), connections (address book contacts), status information, and customer support communications. Automatically collected data includes usage and log information (activity, settings, interactions, time, frequency, duration), device and connection information (hardware, OS, battery, signal, app version, IP address, identifiers), and location information (precise with permission, general from IP). Third parties provide information about users (e.g., contacts from other users, user reports). Information is used to operate, provide, improve, customize, support, and market services, including connecting with other Meta Company Products. WhatsApp shares information with those you communicate with, and with third-party service providers and other Meta Companies for infrastructure, marketing, research, security, and customer service. WhatsApp emphasizes end-to-end encryption for messages and calls. Users can manage and delete their information through in-app settings, including deleting their account.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive privacy policy for WhatsApp, a major Meta product, detailing data collection, usage, sharing, and user controls.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Meta Privacy Policy - How Meta Collects and Uses User Data\", \"summary\": \"Meta collects information about users and their activity on and off Facebook and Instagram, including content provided (posts, likes, comments, connections, transactions), information from other people (tags), and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location). This data is used to provide personalized experiences, content, and ad recommendations, and for research and development. Meta's privacy policy updates focus on clarifying how data is used, particularly with interactions with Meta AI, and emphasizes that private messages with friends and family are not used to train AIs unless explicitly shared. Users have controls to manage their privacy settings, including who sees their posts and ad topics.\", \"relevance\": 0.97, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the main privacy policy for Meta's core platforms like Facebook and Instagram, covering broad data practices, even if the full content wasn't directly provided in the search results, its scope is clear from related snippets.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy | Meta | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"This supplemental privacy policy details data collection for Meta accounts and Meta VR Products (e.g., Quest devices). For Meta accounts, it collects name, contact info, password, date of birth, and username. For VR products, it collects information about connections, physical characteristics and movements (headset position, controller speed, audio data for avatar animation), hand/body/eye tracking data (processed on device), Meta VR Product activity (payments, events, purchases, app usage, time/frequency/duration), content created, fitness information (calories, activity, goals), gameplay statistics, environmental information, and camera/audio information (raw images processed on device, recorded audio in Worlds if microphone on, crash logs). Voice conversations with Meta AI are also processed. Device information and data from partners/third parties are collected. This data is used to provide social features, personalize content and ads, and improve Meta VR Products. Information is shared with organizations managing Meta accounts, and with third-party services and partners.\", \"relevance\": 0.96, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This policy is highly relevant as it specifically addresses data collection and usage for Meta's VR/AR hardware and associated services, providing detailed insights into biometric and activity data.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.facebook.com/terms/\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Meta Terms of Service\", \"summary\": \"Meta's Terms of Service outline the agreement between users and Meta Platforms, Inc. for using Facebook and other covered products and services. By using these apps, users agree to these terms. The terms include specific explanations regarding the misuse of Meta's apps and data scraping, clarifying that automated data collection without permission is prohibited, even when logged in. It also includes qualifiers for Avatar and AI use, referencing separate supplemental terms for these features, which cover the use of personal data inputs (e.g., selfie videos for avatar creation, AI chat conversations shared with third parties for search results or internal reviews). The terms also consolidate Community Standards for Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and Threads into a central location.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the main terms of service for Meta's core platforms, outlining user agreements, acceptable use, and references to data handling in the context of platform usage.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/supplemental-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Terms Of Service | Meta Quest | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"These supplemental terms apply to Meta Platforms Technologies (MPT) Products, including Meta VR Products. Users must be at least 13 (or 10-12 with parental account management) to create an account and must provide accurate, up-to-date personal data. Users are responsible for their own and other users' (including children's) activities on their MPT Products, and for complying with privacy laws regarding recording and biometric data. Users grant Meta permission to use their name, profile picture, and actions with ads and sponsored content in MPT Products and across Meta Company Products if accounts are connected. The terms detail licenses for software and content, and the use of third-party services, which are subject to their own terms. Meta may change or limit functionality and updates these terms periodically, with continued use signifying acceptance. It also includes an arbitration notice, waiving rights to jury trials and class actions for certain disputes.\", \"relevance\": 0.94, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This document provides specific terms of service for Meta's hardware products, including important details on account requirements, user responsibilities, data permissions, and dispute resolution.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://about.instagram.com/data-policy?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"About Instagram's Data Policy\", \"summary\": \"Instagram collects information about users and their activity, both on and off Facebook and Instagram. This includes content provided (posts, likes, comments), connections, transactions, usage of products, information from other people (tags), and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location). Data is also collected from partners (websites visited, apps used, purchases). This information is used to provide a personalized experience, improve services, and for market research. Instagram shares data with people and accounts based on audience choices and settings, with services users grant access to, with advertisers to measure ad effectiveness, with companies offering products through Instagram, with vendors and service providers, and with researchers. Data can be accessed and downloaded, and users can delete posts or temporarily disable/delete their account, though information shared by others about them is not deleted.\", \"relevance\": 0.93, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official data policy for Instagram, a key Meta platform, providing a clear overview of data collection, usage, sharing, and user controls specific to Instagram.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Portal Data Policy | Meta Portal | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"This policy outlines data collection for Meta Portal devices. It collects camera and audio information (technical call info, Smart Camera processing on device for framing, voice interactions including wake words, audio recordings, and transcripts for service improvement), environmental data (ambient light), device performance and reliability data (crash reports, system logs), information and content provided directly to the device (names, contacts, photos, videos, drawings), and information about third-party service usage. This data is used to detect engagement, regulate device performance, improve reliability, and offer/improve voice services. Information is shared with people with physical access to the device, with third parties for product improvement and legal compliance (e.g., vendors for speech recognition), and with third parties to facilitate their services on Portal devices (e.g., device name, IP address, zip code). Users can manage privacy settings and are informed about consumer privacy rights.\", \"relevance\": 0.92, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This policy is highly relevant as it provides specific and detailed data practices for Meta Portal devices, including sensitive data like camera, audio, and voice interactions.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://opensource.fb.com/legal/privacy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy | Meta Open Source\", \"summary\": \"Meta Open Source collects information users provide directly (contact info, correspondence) and automatically (device attributes, operations, identifiers, network and connections, video/text content from apps). Cookies and similar technologies (Google Analytics) are used to understand service usage. Information is used to provide, personalize, and improve services, promote safety and security, and for other disclosed purposes. Data is shared with service providers (hosting, communications, analytics), for legal purposes (subpoenas, fraud detection), in business transfers, and with user consent. Meta does not knowingly collect information from children under 13. Data is retained until no longer necessary for the collected purposes, with longer retention for legal or safety reasons. Users in the European Region and UK have specific rights (data portability, access, rectify, erase, object, restrict processing) and can contact Meta Platforms Ireland Ltd. or Meta Platforms, Inc. respectively.\", \"relevance\": 0.88, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is an official privacy policy from Meta, specifically for its open-source initiatives, providing details on data collection, usage, sharing, and retention in that context.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://about.fb.com/news/2022/05/metas-updated-privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Here's What You Need to Know About Our Updated Privacy Policy and Terms of Service\", \"summary\": \"This Meta newsroom article announces updates to Meta's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service, emphasizing that the changes aim for clearer communication about data practices without altering how data is collected, used, or shared. It highlights Meta's commitment to personalized experiences with strong data protections and transparency. The update includes new audience controls for Facebook posts and consolidated ad topic and interest category controls across Facebook and Instagram. It also introduces the Privacy Center as a hub for privacy questions, controls, and security tips, reflecting Meta's response to user feedback and evolving regulations.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This newsroom article provides valuable context and an overview of Meta's privacy policy updates and their intentions, including new features for user control.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 2}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This document from Google's Safety Center outlines Google's privacy practices and protections, emphasizing a 'Safer by Design' approach. It details core privacy principles, the use of privacy-preserving technologies, and product-specific safeguards. The policy highlights Google's commitment to transparency, user control, and data minimization, ensuring personal information is respected and protected.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google builds products that are private by design for everyone, being thoughtful about data use and protection.\", \"Google never sells personal information to anyone, including for advertising purposes.\", \"Google is transparent about what data it collects and why, making this information easy to find and understand.\", \"Google makes it easy for users to control their personal information, allowing them to review, download, move, or delete data.\", \"Google reduces the data it uses to further protect privacy, never using content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos for advertising.\", \"Google does not use sensitive information (health, race, religion, sexual orientation) to tailor ads.\", \"Auto-delete controls are the default for new Google Accounts, regularly deleting online activity data after 18 months.\", \"Google protects users by building products that are secure by default, using advanced security infrastructures.\", \"Google innovates advanced privacy technologies (anonymization, federated learning) and shares them with others to enhance internet safety.\", \"Data minimization limits the use of personal information, retaining it only as long as useful.\", \"Google is committed to complying with applicable data-protection laws and works with authorities globally.\", \"Product-specific privacy protections are highlighted for Android, Gmail, Nest, Assistant, Photos, Chrome, Google One, Pixel, Family Link, Google Pay, Search, Fitbit, Maps, YouTube, Gemini, and Meet.\", \"Users can access Ad Settings, Security Settings, Privacy Settings, and Parental Controls to customize their experiences.\"], \"relevance\": 0.95}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center provides an overview of Google's Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and approach to AI. It emphasizes Google's commitment to user privacy and security, outlines the expectations for users, and details the principles guiding responsible AI development. The page serves as a central point for accessing more detailed policies and resources.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google's Privacy Policy explains what information is collected, why, how it's used, and how to review, update, or remove data.\", \"Google API Services User Data Policy focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs, including appropriate use and transparent notice/control.\", \"Google Terms of Service define what users can expect from Google services and what Google expects from users, covering service development, product rules, intellectual property, and legal rights.\", \"Google API Terms of Service explain rules for developer access to Google APIs, including content, privacy, security, intellectual property, and legal rights.\", \"Google's approach to AI development is grounded in organizing the world's information and making it universally accessible and useful.\", \"Google is committed to the responsible development of AI and shares knowledge, research, tools, datasets, and resources with the community.\", \"A Responsible AI Progress Report details how Google governs, maps, measures, and manages AI risk throughout the development lifecycle.\", \"The Gemini Apps Privacy Hub provides information on how Google handles user data when interacting with Gemini Apps, including controls and settings.\", \"The Generative AI Prohibited Use Policy outlines responsible and legal usage of Generative AI services, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"Google's Privacy and Security Principles guide its products and processes to keep sensitive data private, safe, and secure.\"], \"relevance\": 0.9}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This is the central hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, offering an overview of its Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. It provides quick access to detailed policies and links to related resources like the Google Safety Center and Google Account, emphasizing user control over personal information and Google's commitment to privacy and security principles.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"The Google Privacy Policy explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how to review and update it.\", \"The Google Terms of Service describe the rules users agree to when using Google services.\", \"The Google Safety Center provides information on built-in security, privacy controls, and tools for setting digital ground rules for families.\", \"The Google Account offers a central place for users to control, protect, and secure their account, with access to settings and tools for data safeguarding and privacy protection.\", \"Google's Privacy and Security Principles guide its products, processes, and people in keeping user data private, safe, and secure.\", \"The Google Product Privacy Guide helps users manage privacy features built into Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\"], \"relevance\": 0.85}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Meta's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.gen_ai.operation.name: invoke_agent
attributes.gen_ai.agent.name: Strands Agents
attributes.system_prompt:
You are the SUMMARY AGENT.

You take:
- search_result: the raw results from search_agent (contains URLs & policy types)
- extraction_result: the structured extracted points from extract_agent
- user_query: what the user is asking for (e.g., "data collection practices")

Your job is to generate a FINAL TRANSPARENT SUMMARY with the following goals:

1. Summarize the company's data practices clearly and concisely.
2. Provide a multi-dimensional rating system:
   - data_collection_risk: 1–5
   - data_sharing_risk: 1–5
   - tracking_risk: 1–5
   - transparency_score: 1–5
3. Explain WHY you assigned each rating.
   - Refer EXPLICITLY to specific extracted_points and their source URLs.
4. Provide user safety guidance:
   - How users can protect themselves on this platform.
   - What settings they can change.
   - What rights they have (e.g. delete data, opt-out of tracking).
5. Provide a final consumer-friendly summary:
   - “Should users be concerned?”
   - “How careful should users be?”
6. List all sources used, with URLs and relevance.

STRICT OUTPUT FORMAT:
{
  "status": "success" | "error",
  "query": "<original query>",
  "summary": {
    "overview": "<plain-language high-level summary>",
    "key_findings": ["...", "..."],
    "ratings": {
      "data_collection_risk": <1-5>,
      "data_sharing_risk": <1-5>,
      "tracking_risk": <1-5>,
      "transparency_score": <1-5>
    },
    "reasoning": [
      {
        "rating": "<which rating>",
        "evidence": [
          {
            "url": "<source url>",
            "point": "<specific extracted_point from extraction_result>"
          }
        ],
        "explanation": "<why this evidence led to the rating>"
      }
    ],
    "user_protection_advice": ["...", "..."],
    "final_recommendation": "<string>"
  },
  "sources_used": [
    {
      "url": "<string>",
      "policy_type": "<string>",
      "relevance": <float>,
      "title": "<string or null>"
    }
  ],
  "error_message": "<null or string>"
}

RULES:
- No markdown.
- No code fences.
- Citations MUST reference actual URLs from search_result.
- Evidence MUST reference extracted_points from extraction_result.
- If extraction_result.status != success → return status:error.

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"status": "success", "query": "Summarize Meta's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).", "summary": {"overview": "Meta operates a vast ecosystem of products including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, and VR/AR devices (Quest, Portal), each with specific and interconnected data practices. Meta collects an extensive range of personal information, from user-provided content and activity to device data, precise location, and even biometric information (e.g., physical movements, eye tracking) for its hardware products. This data is primarily used for personalization, targeted advertising, service improvement, and research. While Meta states it does not sell personal information, it shares data extensively within its family of companies and with third-party partners. Users are provided with various controls to manage their privacy settings, content, and account data across these platforms.", "key_findings": ["Meta collects a comprehensive array of data, including user-provided content, connections, device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location), activity on and off its platforms, and for VR/AR products, highly sensitive data like physical characteristics, movements, hand/body/eye tracking, and voice interactions.", "Data is used to provide personalized experiences, content, and ad recommendations, improve services, and for research and development across Meta's interconnected products.", "WhatsApp messages are end-to-end encrypted, but metadata such as account information, usage, logs, device, and connection details are still collected.", "Meta shares information extensively within its family of companies (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, VR products), with third-party service providers, partners, and advertisers (for ad measurement).", "Meta's Terms of Service prohibit automated data collection (scraping) without permission and outline user responsibilities, especially for VR products regarding privacy laws and biometric data.", "Users have controls to manage privacy settings, audience choices, ad topics, download data, delete posts, or temporarily disable/delete their accounts across various Meta platforms.", "For Meta VR Products, users grant Meta permission to use their name, profile picture, and actions with ads and sponsored content across Meta Company Products if accounts are connected."], "ratings": {"data_collection_risk": 5, "data_sharing_risk": 4, "tracking_risk": 5, "transparency_score": 3}, "reasoning": [{"rating": "data_collection_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "WhatsApp collects account information (phone number, profile name), messages (stored encrypted temporarily for delivery, then deleted), connections (address book contacts), status information, and customer support communications. Automatically collected data includes usage and log information (activity, settings, interactions, time, frequency, duration), device and connection information (hardware, OS, battery, signal, app version, IP address, identifiers), and location information (precise with permission, general from IP)."}, {"url": "https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/", "point": "Meta collects information about users and their activity on and off Facebook and Instagram, including content provided (posts, likes, comments, connections, transactions), information from other people (tags), and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location)."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "For VR products, it collects information about connections, physical characteristics and movements (headset position, controller speed, audio data for avatar animation), hand/body/eye tracking data (processed on device), Meta VR Product activity (payments, events, purchases, app usage, time/frequency/duration), content created, fitness information (calories, activity, goals), gameplay statistics, environmental information, and camera/audio information (raw images processed on device, recorded audio in Worlds if microphone on, crash logs). Voice conversations with Meta AI are also processed."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "It collects camera and audio information (technical call info, Smart Camera processing on device for framing, voice interactions including wake words, audio recordings, and transcripts for service improvement), environmental data (ambient light), device performance and reliability data (crash reports, system logs), information and content provided directly to the device (names, contacts, photos, videos, drawings), and information about third-party service usage."}], "explanation": "Meta collects an extremely broad and deep range of personal information across its diverse product ecosystem. This includes highly sensitive data such as precise location, extensive activity on and off its platforms, and for its VR/AR devices, biometric data like physical movements, hand/body/eye tracking, and camera/audio information. This pervasive and multi-modal data collection, even with some on-device processing, represents the highest level of data collection risk."}, {"rating": "data_sharing_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "WhatsApp shares information with those you communicate with, and with third-party service providers and other Meta Companies for infrastructure, marketing, research, security, and customer service."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information is shared with organizations managing Meta accounts, and with third-party services and partners."}, {"url": "https://about.instagram.com/data-policy?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Instagram shares data with people and accounts based on audience choices and settings, with services users grant access to, with advertisers to measure ad effectiveness, with companies offering products through Instagram, with vendors and service providers, and with researchers."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Information is shared with people with physical access to the device, with third parties for product improvement and legal compliance (e.g., vendors for speech recognition), and with third parties to facilitate their services on Portal devices (e.g., device name, IP address, zip code)."}], "explanation": "While Meta states it does not sell personal information, it engages in extensive internal sharing across its family of companies to provide integrated services and personalized experiences. Data is also shared with a wide array of third-party service providers, partners, and advertisers for various purposes, including ad measurement. This broad scope of sharing, both within the Meta ecosystem and with external entities, contributes to a high data sharing risk."}, {"rating": "tracking_risk", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/", "point": "Meta collects information about users and their activity on and off Facebook and Instagram, including content provided... and device information (identifiers, cookies, camera, microphone, location)."}, {"url": "https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "Automatically collected data includes usage and log information (activity, settings, interactions, time, frequency, duration), device and connection information (hardware, OS, battery, signal, app version, IP address, identifiers), and location information (precise with permission, general from IP)."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "For VR products, it collects information about connections, physical characteristics and movements (headset position, controller speed, audio data for avatar animation), hand/body/eye tracking data (processed on device), Meta VR Product activity (payments, events, purchases, app usage, time/frequency/duration)..."}, {"url": "https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/", "point": "This data is used to provide personalized experiences, content, and ad recommendations, and for research and development."}], "explanation": "Meta's business model is fundamentally built on comprehensive tracking of user behavior, preferences, and interactions across its own platforms and extensively off-platform through partners, websites, and apps. This involves persistent identifiers, cookies, device information, location data, and detailed activity logs, including highly granular physical and biometric tracking for its VR/AR products. This pervasive and continuous tracking for personalization and targeted advertising results in an extremely high tracking risk."}, {"rating": "transparency_score", "evidence": [{"url": "https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/", "point": "Meta's privacy policy updates focus on clarifying how data is used, particularly with interactions with Meta AI, and emphasizes that private messages with friends and family are not used to train AIs unless explicitly shared."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "This supplemental privacy policy details data collection for Meta accounts and Meta VR Products (e.g., Quest devices)."}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "This policy outlines data collection for Meta Portal devices."}, {"url": "https://www.facebook.com/terms/", "point": "Meta's Terms of Service outline the agreement between users and Meta Platforms, Inc. for using Facebook and other covered products and services."}, {"url": "https://about.fb.com/news/2022/05/metas-updated-privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "point": "This Meta newsroom article announces updates to Meta's Privacy Policy and Terms of Service, emphasizing that the changes aim for clearer communication about data practices... It also introduces the Privacy Center as a hub for privacy questions, controls, and security tips..."}], "explanation": "Meta provides numerous, often product-specific, privacy policies and terms of service, and has made efforts to clarify its data practices through updates and a Privacy Center. While the information is available, the sheer volume, complexity, and interconnectedness of data collection and sharing across Meta's vast ecosystem can make it challenging for an average user to fully understand and effectively manage their privacy. This fragmentation and scale, despite efforts for clarity, lead to a moderate transparency score."}], "user_protection_advice": ["Regularly review and adjust your privacy settings on each Meta platform you use (Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Quest, Portal) as settings can vary and impact data collection and sharing.", "Utilize audience controls on Facebook and Instagram to limit who sees your posts and information.", "Manage your ad preferences and ad topics to reduce the personalization of ads, though this may not stop data collection for ad measurement.", "Be mindful of permissions granted to Meta apps and devices, especially for camera, microphone, location, and for VR products, physical movement and biometric data.", "For WhatsApp, while messages are end-to-end encrypted, be aware that metadata (who you communicate with, when, and device information) is still collected and shared with other Meta companies.", "Consider using Meta's tools to download your data to understand what information is collected, and delete specific posts or your account if you wish to remove your information.", "For Meta VR Products, understand that granting permission to use your name, profile picture, and actions with ads and sponsored content can extend across all Meta Company Products if accounts are connected."], "final_recommendation": "Users should be highly concerned about their privacy when using Meta's products. The company's business model relies on extensive and pervasive data collection and tracking across its vast ecosystem, including highly sensitive personal and biometric information. While Meta provides numerous privacy controls, the sheer volume and interconnectedness of data collection make it challenging for users to fully grasp and manage their privacy. Users should be extremely careful, proactively and regularly configure their privacy settings on every Meta platform they use, and consider the implications of sharing such a broad range of personal data with a single company."}, "sources_used": [{"url": "https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.98, "title": "Privacy Policy"}, {"url": "https://www.facebook.com/privacy/policy/", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.97, "title": "Meta Privacy Policy - How Meta Collects and Uses User Data"}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.96, "title": "Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Privacy Policy | Meta | Meta Store"}, {"url": "https://www.facebook.com/terms/", "policy_type": "terms_of_service", "relevance": 0.95, "title": "Meta Terms of Service"}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/supplemental-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "terms_of_service", "relevance": 0.94, "title": "Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Terms Of Service | Meta Quest | Meta Store"}, {"url": "https://about.instagram.com/data-policy?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.93, "title": "About Instagram's Data Policy"}, {"url": "https://www.meta.com/legal/portal/data-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "data_protection", "relevance": 0.92, "title": "Supplemental Portal Data Policy | Meta Portal | Meta Store"}, {"url": "https://opensource.fb.com/legal/privacy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "privacy_policy", "relevance": 0.88, "title": "Privacy Policy | Meta Open Source"}, {"url": "https://about.fb.com/news/2022/05/metas-updated-privacy-policy/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral", "policy_type": "other", "relevance": 0.85, "title": "Here's What You Need to Know About Our Updated Privacy Policy and Terms of Service"}], "error_message": null}

attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

attributes.content: [{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Google\", \"resolved_domain\": \"google.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy \\u2013 Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"Google collects information to provide and improve its services, including data you provide (name, password, phone, payment info, content you create), information from your apps, browsers, and devices (unique identifiers, settings, IP address, crash reports), your activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice info, purchase activity, communication, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices). Data is used for service provision, maintenance, improvement, new service development, personalization (content and ads), performance measurement, communication, and protection against fraud and security issues. Google does not sell personal information. Information is shared with consent, with domain administrators, for external processing, and for legal reasons. Data is retained for varying periods, with options for users to delete or auto-delete certain data. Google employs security measures like encryption and access restrictions. Users have controls to manage, review, update, export, and delete their information through their Google Account, Activity Controls, Ad settings, and browser/device settings.\", \"relevance\": 0.98, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the official and comprehensive Google Privacy Policy, directly addressing all aspects of data collection, usage, sharing, retention, and user rights.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://safety.google/privacy/data/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"data_protection\", \"title\": \"Your privacy is protected by responsible data practices.\", \"summary\": \"Google emphasizes its commitment to privacy by design, stating it never sells personal information and is transparent about data collection and usage. It provides users with easy controls to manage their data, including reviewing, downloading, and deleting it. Google protects data with advanced security infrastructures and continuously innovates privacy technologies, sharing them with others. Data minimization practices include auto-deletion of Location History and Web & App Activity after 18 months by default for new accounts. Users can view and delete data through Dashboard and My Activity, and export their data. Google complies with applicable data protection laws and works with regulatory authorities.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page directly addresses Google's data protection principles, practices, and user controls, providing a high-level overview of their approach to privacy and data handling.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://transparency.google/intl/en_us/our-policies/privacy-policy-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and AI - Transparency Center\", \"summary\": \"This page from Google's Transparency Center outlines their commitment to user privacy and security, guided by Privacy and Security Principles. It explains what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review, update, or remove their data. It also mentions the Google API Services User Data Policy, which focuses on privacy and security requirements for developers using Google APIs. Additionally, it touches upon Google's approach to responsible AI development and related privacy hubs and policies for Gemini Apps and Generative AI, including restrictions on content creation and distribution.\", \"relevance\": 0.9, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This page provides a good overview of Google's privacy policy, terms of service, and specific policies related to AI, acting as a central hub for understanding their data practices.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"other\", \"title\": \"Privacy & Terms \\u2013 Google\", \"summary\": \"This is the main hub for Google's Privacy & Terms, providing an overview of what information Google collects, why, how it's used, and how users can review and update it. It links to the full Privacy Policy and Terms of Service. The page also highlights the Google Safety Center, Google Account for managing privacy, and Google's Privacy and Security Principles. It emphasizes user control over personal information and usage history across various Google products like Gmail, Search, and YouTube.\", \"relevance\": 0.85, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the overarching page for Google's privacy and terms, serving as an entry point to more detailed policies. It provides a good summary of their privacy principles and links to relevant resources.\"}], \"error_message\": null, \"meta\": {\"attempts\": 1}}, \"extraction_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"task_prompt\": \"privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices\", \"results\": [{\"url\": \"https://policies.google.com/privacy?hl=en-US&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"content_summary\": \"This Google Privacy Policy outlines what information Google collects, why it collects it, and how users can update, manage, export, and delete their information. It applies to all services offered by Google LLC and its affiliates, including YouTube and Android, and services on third-party sites. The policy also addresses compliance with European Union and United Kingdom data protection laws, detailing user rights and Google's obligations.\", \"extracted_points\": [\"Google collects information to provide, maintain, and improve its services, develop new offerings, and personalize user experiences, including content and ads.\", \"Data is also used to measure performance, communicate with users, and protect Google, its users, and the public from fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues.\", \"Information collected includes data provided by users (name, password, phone, payment, content), data from apps/browsers/devices (unique identifiers, IP address, crash reports), user activity (searches, videos, ad interactions, voice, purchases, communications, third-party site activity, Chrome history), and location information (GPS, IP address, sensor data, nearby devices).\", \"Information is also collected from publicly accessible sources and trusted partners (directory services, marketing, security partners).\", \"Data collection technologies include cookies, pixel tags, local storage, databases, and server logs.\", \"User privacy controls are available through Google Account settings (Activity Controls, Ad settings, About you, Shared endorsements), Privacy Checkup, My Activity, Google Dashboard, and device/browser settings.\", \"Information sharing occurs with user consent, with domain administrators, for external processing by trusted parties, and for legal reasons (law, regulation, legal process, governmental requests, Terms of Service enforcement, fraud/security protection, public safety). Non-personally identifiable information may be shared publicly with partners.\", \"Security measures include encryption for data in transit, security features (Safe Browsing, 2 Step Verification), review of data practices, physical security, and restricted access to personal information for authorized personnel.\", \"Users can export a copy of their data or delete content from specific services, items from My Activity, specific products, or their entire Google Account. An Inactive Account Manager allows designated access.\", \"Data retention varies: some data is kept until deleted by the user or auto-deleted, some is deleted/anonymized automatically after a set period, some is kept until account deletion, and some is retained longer for legitimate business or legal purposes (security, fraud prevention, financial records). A deletion process ensures safe removal, with potential delays.\", \"Google will not reduce user rights under this Privacy Policy without explicit consent.\", \"Personalized ads are not shown based on sensitive categories (race, religion, sexual orientation, health) or content from Drive, Gmail, or Photos.\", \"Personally identifiable information is not shared with advertisers unless explicitly requested by the user.\", \"Explicit consent is required before using information for purposes not covered in the Privacy Policy.\", \"Google complies with applicable data protection laws, including EU and UK regulations, and provides mechanisms for users to exercise their rights.\", \"Data processing is based on legal grounds such as contract performance, legitimate interests, vital interests, legal obligations, or user consent.\", \"Google (Google Ireland Limited for EEA/Switzerland, Google LLC for UK and global Search/Maps) acts as the data controller, responsible for processing information and complying with privacy laws.\", \"Users are responsible for managing their privacy settings and exercising their rights to control, review, update, export, and delete their information.\", \"Domain administrators (for organizational accounts) have access to and control over user accounts, including the ability to access/retain information, view statistics, change passwords, suspend/terminate access, and restrict data management options.\", \"Affiliates and trusted third-party businesses process personal information on Google's behalf, adhering to Google's instructions, Privacy Policy, and confidentiality/security measures.\", \"Partners (publishers, advertisers, developers, rights holders) may collect information from user browsers/devices for advertising and measurement purposes, or receive non-personally identifiable information from Google.\", \"Google continuously works to detect, prevent, and respond to fraud, abuse, security risks, and technical issues that could harm Google, its users, or the public.\", \"The policy is regularly reviewed for compliance, and Google processes information in ways that adhere to it.\", \"Data transfers occur globally, with the same protections applied regardless of server location, and Google complies with legal frameworks for data transfer.\", \"For EU/UK users, Google provides controls to exercise rights (access, update, remove, restrict processing, object, export) and offers contact points for questions or concerns, including local data protection authorities.\", \"Google responds to formal written complaints and cooperates with regulatory authorities to resolve data transfer issues.\", \"Personal information is shared for legal reasons, including responding to applicable laws, regulations, legal processes, or enforceable governmental requests, with details published in a Transparency Report.\", \"Google analyzes content to detect abuse (spam, malware, illegal content) and may disable accounts or report violations to authorities. Age verification processes are in place to ensure users meet service requirements.\", \"The Privacy Policy is effective July 1, 2025, with archived versions available.\", \"Key terms such as 'Affiliates', 'Algorithm', 'Cookies', 'Personal information', and 'Sensitive personal information' are defined within the policy.\", \"Specific privacy notices are provided for various Google services like Payments, Fiber, Gemini Apps, YouTube Kids, and Google Workspace for Education.\", \"Additional resources are available, including Your Google Account, Privacy Checkup, Google\\u2019s safety center, Google\\u2019s Teen Privacy Guide, and information on technologies used.\", \"Changes to the policy will not reduce user rights without explicit consent, and significant changes will be communicated with prominent notice.\", \"EU users have choices regarding linking certain Google services.\"], \"relevance\": 0.98}], \"error_message\": null}, \"query\": \"Summarize Google's privacy policies, terms of service, and data practices (data collection, usage, sharing, retention, user rights, cookies, API usage, etc.).\"}"}]

[{"text": "{\"search_result\": {\"status\": \"success\", \"company_or_url\": \"Meta\", \"resolved_domain\": \"meta.com\", \"sources\": [{\"url\": \"https://www.whatsapp.com/legal/privacy-policy?lang=en&utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"privacy_policy\", \"title\": \"Privacy Policy\", \"summary\": \"WhatsApp collects account information (phone number, profile name), messages (stored encrypted temporarily for delivery, then deleted), connections (address book contacts), status information, and customer support communications. The terms also consolidate Community Standards for Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and Threads into a central location.\", \"relevance\": 0.95, \"relevance_explanation\": \"This is the main terms of service for Meta's core platforms, outlining user agreements, acceptable use, and references to data handling in the context of platform usage.\"}, {\"url\": \"https://www.meta.com/legal/supplemental-terms-of-service/?utm_source=valyu.ai&utm_medium=referral\", \"policy_type\": \"terms_of_service\", \"title\": \"Supplemental Meta Platforms Technologies Terms Of Service | Meta Quest | Meta Store\", \"summary\": \"These supplemental terms apply to Meta Platforms Technologies (MPT) Products, including Meta VR Products.
